Sentencas: The feasibility of employing biochar as a fuel in a direct carbon fuel cell (DCFC) or a hybrid carbon fuel cell (HCFC) is investigated in the present study, by utilizing bare biochar or biochar/carbonate mixture as feedstock, respectively.
Titulo: Assessment of biochar as feedstock in a direct carbon solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Three different types of biochars, i.e., pistachio shells (PI), pecan shells (PE) and sawdust (SD) are used as feedstock in a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) of a type: Biochar vertical bar Co-CeO2/YSZ/Ag vertical bar Air.
Titulo: Assessment of biochar as feedstock in a direct carbon solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: All samples were characterized by means of chemical composition (ultimate/proximate analysis), mercury porosimetry, N-2 adsorption-desorption isotherms (BET method), thermogravimetric analysis (TGA), Fourier Transform Infrared Spectroscopy (FTIR), X-ray Diffraction (XRD) and Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM), to obtain a close correlation between cell performance and biochar characteristics.
Titulo: Assessment of biochar as feedstock in a direct carbon solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The electrochemical measurements reveal that the optimum performance, in terms of maximum power density (P-max), is obtained for the PI biochar, which demonstrated a power output of 15.5 mW cm(-2) at 800 degrees C, compared to 14 and 10 mW cm(-2) for PE and SD biochars, respectively.
Titulo: Assessment of biochar as feedstock in a direct carbon solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The obtained cell performance results are interpreted on the basis of biochar physicochemical characteristics and AC impedance spectroscopy studies.
Titulo: Assessment of biochar as feedstock in a direct carbon solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The superior performance of PI biochar is attributed to a synergistic effect of several physicochemical characteristics, involving the porosity, the acidity, the volatile matter, the carbon and hydrogen content as well as the population of oxygenated surface functionalities.
Titulo: Assessment of biochar as feedstock in a direct carbon solid oxide fuel cell
